question.text: The correct statement about diseases of the cardiovascular system is

options.text: Blood pressure of about 140/100 mm Hg causes rupturing of blood vessels of eyes.
Hypertension significantly increases the after load on the heart, causes decrease in the heart size     and finally heart failure.
Coronary artery disease refers to a condition such as arteriosclerosis which causes formation of        plaque which decreases the size of lumen of coronary arteries.
The pain of Angina pectoris is severe, in the chest, and referred to the neck, lower jaw, left arm and left shoulder. It may disappear with rest.

solution.text: Blood pressure of <math><mrow><mrow><mn>210</mn></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mrow></math> causes rupturing of blood vessels in brain. High blood pressure is also known as hypertension. It significantly causes increase in load of the heart. In Coronary artery disease there is accumulation of cholesterol which narrows the lumen of the heart. The pain of Angina pectoris is severe, in the chest and referred to the neck, lower jaw, left arm, and left shoulder. It may disappear with rest.
